title: Bond SIPs offer better returns for risk-averse investors at around 5.5% interest: Suresh Darak
summary: Bondbazaar's Suresh Darak discusses RBI's introduction of SIPs in the bond market, starting with treasury bills, offering risk-averse investors a new avenue. These SIPs allow fixed amount investments on specific dates, similar to equity SIPs, with yields around 5.5%.
fullContent: Bondbazaar's Suresh Darak discusses RBI's introduction of SIPs in the bond market, starting with treasury bills, offering risk-averse investors a new avenue. These SIPs allow fixed amount investments on specific dates, similar to equity SIPs, with yields around 5.5%. While not as lucrative as liquid mutual funds, they are better than idle savings accounts, especially for those averse to risk.

title: Vodafone Idea stock hits fresh 52-week low ahead of Q1 results
summary: Vodafone Idea shares dropped 3.5% to Rs 6.12 ahead of Q1 FY26 earnings, extending a nearly 60% decline over the past year due to financial concerns and mounting losses. Technical indicators, including a broken trendline, RSI at 32.

Technical indicators, including a broken trendline, RSI at 32.8, and trading below key SMAs, point to continued weakness and bearish momentum.

title: ‘US too large to write off’: Trump’s 50% tariffs threaten 70% of India’s exports, ICRIER warns
summary: New tariffs from Donald Trump may impact seventy percent of India's exports. ICRIER suggests policy changes and trade talks with the US. Focus areas include agriculture and GM crops. Textiles and gems are vulnerable sectors. The report urges modernisation and diversification.
fullContent: New tariffs from Donald Trump may impact seventy percent of India's exports. ICRIER suggests policy changes and trade talks with the US. Focus areas include agriculture and GM crops. Textiles and gems are vulnerable sectors. The report urges modernisation and diversification. It proposes re-engagement with the US and FTAs with other nations.

title: Real estate winners: How infrastructure and jobs drove India’s top-performing micro markets
summary: Indian housing micro markets showed great returns between 2021 and mid-2025. Property prices nearly doubled in some areas. Rental growth also surpassed inflation. Employment and infrastructure upgrades drove this surge. Noida's Sector-150 led with a 139% price increase.
fullContent: Indian housing micro markets showed great returns between 2021 and mid-2025. Property prices nearly doubled in some areas. Rental growth also surpassed inflation. Employment and infrastructure upgrades drove this surge. Noida's Sector-150 led with a 139% price increase. Bengaluru and Hyderabad also saw significant gains. Experts project continued growth through 2026, especially in areas with new infrastructure.

summary: Japanese government bonds experienced a decline on Thursday following U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's remarks, fueling speculation about a potential policy shift by the Bank of Japan. The five-year yield reached a two-week high, while the 10-year yield climbed to its...
fullContent: Japanese government bonds experienced a decline on Thursday following U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's remarks, fueling speculation about a potential policy shift by the Bank of Japan. The five-year yield reached a two-week high, while the 10-year yield climbed to its highest level since August 1.

title: India bonds steady ahead of New Delhi's debt sale
summary: Indian government bonds remained rangebound as investors awaited the results of New Delhi's debt auction, seeking insights into future yield movements. The auction, featuring a 5-year bond and a new 30-year security, is crucial for gauging demand for longer-term notes.
fullContent: Indian government bonds remained rangebound as investors awaited the results of New Delhi's debt auction, seeking insights into future yield movements. The auction, featuring a 5-year bond and a new 30-year security, is crucial for gauging demand for longer-term notes. Traders are also positioning cautiously before the long Independence Day weekend, anticipating opportunistic buying on any dips.

title: NMDC shares slide 5% as Q1 profit dips, but brokerages still bullish. Here’s why
summary: NMDC posted a PAT of Rs 1,969 crore for Q1 FY26, slightly lower than Rs 1,984 crore a year ago, as higher expenses offset strong production and sales. Revenue from operations jumped 23% YoY to Rs 6,634 crore, driven by a 31% rise in iron ore output to 119.
fullContent: NMDC posted a PAT of Rs 1,969 crore for Q1 FY26, slightly lower than Rs 1,984 crore a year ago, as higher expenses offset strong production and sales. Revenue from operations jumped 23% YoY to Rs 6,634 crore, driven by a 31% rise in iron ore output to 119.94 lakh tonnes and a 14% increase in sales to 115.17 lakh tonnes.

title: India Inc’s GST 2.0 Wishlist: Simpler Slabs, Easier Compliance, Fairer Rules
summary: At ETCFO’s “What India Inc Wants from GST 2.0” panel, finance leaders including Deepal Shah, Dev Tripathy, Ankush Jain, Pratik Gupta, and Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal urged slab rationalisation, a single monthly return, and centralised processes to ease compliance.
fullContent: At ETCFO’s “What India Inc Wants from GST 2.0” panel, finance leaders including Deepal Shah, Dev Tripathy, Ankush Jain, Pratik Gupta, and Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal urged slab rationalisation, a single monthly return, and centralised processes to ease compliance. They proposed vendor rating systems, real-time GST credit tracking, and mediation wings to resolve disputes, while calling for penalties to target wilful defaulters rather than compliant buyers.

title: India Inc’s GST 2.0 Wishlist: Simpler Slabs, Easier Compliance, Fairer Rules
summary: At ETCFO’s “What India Inc Wants from GST 2.0” panel, finance leaders including Deepal Shah, Dev Tripathy, Ankush Jain, Pratik Gupta, and Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal urged slab rationalisation, a single monthly return, and centralised processes to ease compliance.
fullContent: At ETCFO’s “What India Inc Wants from GST 2.0” panel, finance leaders including Deepal Shah, Dev Tripathy, Ankush Jain, Pratik Gupta, and Ranjeet Kumar Agarwal urged slab rationalisation, a single monthly return, and centralised processes to ease compliance. They proposed vendor rating systems, real-time GST credit tracking, and mediation wings to resolve disputes, while calling for penalties to target wilful defaulters rather than compliant buyers.

title: India’s retail inflation eases to 8-year low of 1.55% in July; experts see benign outlook ahead
summary: India's retail inflation saw a significant drop in July. It reached a low of 1.55%, the lowest in over eight years. This decline was mainly due to lower food prices. The Reserve Bank of India had earlier cautioned about possible inflation increases.
fullContent: India's retail inflation saw a significant drop in July. It reached a low of 1.55%, the lowest in over eight years. This decline was mainly due to lower food prices. The Reserve Bank of India had earlier cautioned about possible inflation increases. Experts believe inflation will remain within the RBI's target range. This provides room for economic growth.

title: Nitya Shah on financial azaadi: How to build self-reliant portfolio in today's markets
summary: Nitya Shah shares insights on financial independence through long-term investing. He highlights sectors like electronics, defence, and pharma as key to India's self-reliance. Shah advises against leveraged trading and emphasizes SIPs for retail investors.
fullContent: Nitya Shah shares insights on financial independence through long-term investing. He highlights sectors like electronics, defence, and pharma as key to India's self-reliance. Shah advises against leveraged trading and emphasizes SIPs for retail investors. He suggests investing in index funds or flexi-cap funds to celebrate Independence Day. Patience, trust, and self-reliance are crucial investment principles.

title: Carlsberg Narrows Profit Outlook on Boost From Warmer Summer

title: Bitcoin at $124K, reaches all-time high. Here's what experts say

title: Trump orders easing of commercial spaceflight regulations, in boon to Musk's SpaceX
summary: Trump signs order to to eliminate or expedite environmental reviews for launch licences administered by FAA; calls to do away with “outdated, redundant or overly restrictive rules for launch and reentry vehicles”
fullContent: Trump signs order to to eliminate or expedite environmental reviews for launch licences administered by FAA; calls to do away with “outdated, redundant or overly restrictive rules for launch and reentry vehicles”
